alert.note: Alert for Sampson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 8:53PM EST until December 25 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall will continue along the Black River near Tomahawk. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Sampson. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 843 PM EST, river gauge reports indicated the Black River near Tomahawk was at 19.3 ft. Minor flooding is forecast to continue through early Thursday morning. - At 18 ft, minor flooding begins. Water begins to flood NC-411 about one quarter of a mile west of the bridge over the Black River. The Black River and Great Coharie Creek may be near the road levels on Wright Bridge Road and Riley Town Road near the intersection of US-701 outside of Ingold. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ivanhoe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
